required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-extubation Assessment of Laryngeal Symptoms and Severity
clinical_study.official_title: Post-extubation Assessment of Laryngeal Symptoms and Severity

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to learn more about voice and airway problems that patients experience during and after the time patients have an oral endotracheal tube in patients' airway to help patients breathe while receiving mechanical ventilation in an intensive care unit (ICU).

primary_outcome.measure: Laryngeal injury as assessed by 4-point categorical scale
primary_outcome.description: Characterize injuries to the larynx and surrounding tissues/anatomy after mechanical ventilation is no longer required and the oral endotracheal tube is removed. Injuries will be graded on a 4-point categorical scale ranging from 0 (no injury) to 3 (severe injury).

primary_outcome.measure: Laryngeal injury symptom grading by Laryngeal Hypersensitivity Questionnaire (LHQ)
primary_outcome.description: Characterize patient symptoms of laryngeal injury within 48 hours of anticipated extubation. Symptoms will be assessed using a 4-point ordinal scale based on the LHQ, ranging from 1 (all of the time) to 4 (none of the time).

primary_outcome.measure: Laryngeal injury symptom grading by LHQ
primary_outcome.description: Characterize patient symptoms of laryngeal injury within 72 hours post-extubation. Symptoms will be assessed using a 4-point ordinal scale based on the LHQ, ranging from 1 (all of the time) to 4 (none of the time).

primary_outcome.measure: Laryngeal injury symptom grading by LHQ
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post-extubation or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first
primary_outcome.description: Characterize patient symptoms of laryngeal injury at 7 days post-extubation or at discharge whichever comes first. Symptoms will be assessed using a 4-point ordinal scale based on the LHQ, ranging from 1 (all of the time) to 4 (none of the time).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of intubation (directly following study enrollment)
From date of intubation to date of extubation or when trached, whichever comes first, assessed up to 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days from placement to extubation of the oral endotracheal tube

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceptual voice characteristics as assessed by Grade Rough Breathy Asthenic Strained (GRBAS) method
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed from standardized voice samples and digital recordings using the grade, rough, breathy, asthenic, and strained (GRBAS) method with a 4-point ordinal scale ranging from 0 (normal) to 3 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceptual voice characteristics as assessed by GRBAS method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post-extubation or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed from standardized voice samples and digital recordings using the grade, rough, breathy, asthenic, and strained (GRBAS) method with a 4-point ordinal scale ranging from 0 (normal) to 3 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceptual voice characteristics as assessed by Consensus Auditory-Perceptual Evaluation of Voice (CAPE-V)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed from standardized voice samples and digital recordings using the CAPE-V, which is comprised of a 100-point visual analog scale ranging from 0 (normal) to 100 (severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceptual voice characteristics as assessed by CAPE-V
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post-extubation or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed from standardized voice samples and digital recordings using the CAPE-V, which is comprised of a 100-point visual analog scale ranging from 0 (normal) to 100 (severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acoustic voice measurement as assessed by voice analysis software
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed from standardized voice samples and digital recordings using the Computerized Speech Lab (PENTAX Medical) with voice analysis software (viz., Multi-Dimensional Voice Program (MDVP); Analysis of Dysphonia in Speech and Voice (ADSV)) to quantify voice characteristics across a number of parameters

secondary_outcome.measure: Acoustic voice measurement as assessed by voice analysis software
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post-extubation or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed from standardized voice samples and digital recordings using the Computerized Speech Lab (PENTAX Medical) with voice analysis software (viz., Multi-Dimensional Voice Program (MDVP); Analysis of Dysphonia in Speech and Voice (ADSV)) to quantify voice characteristics across a number of parameters.

intervention.description: A flexible camera (fiberoptic endoscope) is placed in the patient's nose to view the nose, throat, and airway.

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) who are orally intubated with mechanical ventilaton meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥18 years old
- Required mechanical ventilation via an oral endotracheal tube
- Anticipated intubation ≥24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to understand or speak English due to a language barrier or cognitive impairment
- Nasal endotracheal intubation during the enrolled admission
- Pre-existing dysphonia, dysphagia
- Pre-existing central nervous system, neuromuscular, or connective tissue disease
- Prior tracheotomy and/or tracheotomy placed prior to enrollment
- Head and/or neck disease
- Head and/or neck surgery other than tonsillectomy
- Prior major thoracic surgery (e.g., sternotomy, thoracotomy)
- Known or suspected anatomical abnormalities or pre-intubation trauma of the oral cavity, pharynx, larynx, or esophagus
- Unlikely to be extubated (i.e., expected death)
